*div1 type="summary"* *p*J. E. B. Austin to Mrs. Emily Perry, August 17, 1825.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Groces Retreat, Texas*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="08-17-1825">Augt 17. 1825*/date_mentioned*.*/p* *p*My Dr *person_mentioned*Sister*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*I have only time to drop you a line by a *person_mentioned*Gentleman */person_mentioned*going to the *location_mentioned*United States */location_mentioned*who promises to place this in the *location_mentioned*post Office*/location_mentioned*— I returned from the *location_mentioned*interior */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="08-10-1825">last week*/date_mentioned* where I have been the last two months on business— I had a severe attack of the fever while there but soon recovered— Some time has lapsed since we have received letters from you tho I expect there must be some in the *location_mentioned*Post Office at N— [Natchitoches.]*/location_mentioned* I have not neglected writing My *person_mentioned*Emily */person_mentioned*every opportunity. *date_mentioned n="08-xx-1824">This time last year*/date_mentioned* I was enjoying the sweet society of my only and dear *person_mentioned*Sister */person_mentioned*and her lovely little *person_mentioned*family*/person_mentioned*— When shall I experience that pleasure again? fond anticipation whispers in my ear that period is not far distant— May the wheels of time roll with redoubled force until that happy hour arrives------ your wild rattled brain *person_mentioned*brother */person_mentioned*spends more of his thoughts on his dear *person_mentioned*Emily */person_mentioned*than probably she is willing to admit— but I can safely assure her that herself and *person_mentioned*family */person_mentioned*ocupies more of my time than any thing in this world—*/p*
*p*I am sorry to say there is considerable sickness in the *location_mentioned*Colony */location_mentioned*this season owing to the high freshe[t]s we have had the sickness has generally been light, no deaths of consequence—and feel confident from my observations so far—that it will not be very fatal—*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Brother */person_mentioned*is well—and has written to you and *person_mentioned*Mr. P.*/person_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="07-xx-1825">about one Month since*/date_mentioned* very lengthly— I am truly happy to hear my Dr *person_mentioned*Sister*/person_mentioned* has an affectionate *person_mentioned*partner */person_mentioned*and hope the ballance of her life will not be checkered with so many vicissitudes as the last few years—*/p*
*p*Give my respects to *person_mentioned*Brother James*/person_mentioned* and also to *person_mentioned*Mr Saml Perry and Lady*/person_mentioned* also to *person_mentioned*Mr. and Mrs. John P*/person_mentioned*— tell *person_mentioned*Mrs. John P.*/person_mentioned* that I have not been able to procure the Seeds I promised-— owing to my absence however next season I will attend to my promise*/p*
*p*Kiss the *person_mentioned*children */person_mentioned*for me and *person_mentioned*Stephen*/person_mentioned*— tell *person_mentioned*Joel */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Austin */person_mentioned*to study hard- *person_mentioned*Jas E B Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
